ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments:
Preclass
- readings
- albums to listen to
- videos to watch
N/A
By appointment virtual office hours.
reading on own

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Skills
- referencing
- how to write a claim, research question
- essay structure

Knowledge
- brand new knowledge on African American culture particularly in terms of music

Insight
- diverse sections of humanities study
- greater appreciation for the role of music in society
A great introduction to college-writing and seminar-style class!
writing, close reading, analyzing
Beyond improving my writing skills, this class taught me how to effectively research very niche topics. Likewise, I gained a greater appreciation for Black culture and its various nuances.
I learned how to write an organized research paper and to think critically about music and sources

I was able to grasp a better understanding of analyzing sources that were not printed(whether that be in the form of interviews or albums) and use these ideas to write a cohesive argument. I also gained more knowledge of neo-soul and the complexities of the music industry during that time.
I learned a lot about how the neo-soul genre evolved an I also built my skills as a writer.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strength
- discussion based
- amazing content
- involves learning practical essay skills

Weaknesses
- remote

Strengths - Professor Jeong Yeon Lee was very accommodating to his students' needs during the pandemic, feedback from drafts was extremely helpful, and readings (although sometimes can be long) were very interesting!
Weaknesses - Felt like we were discussing the readings more than workshopping our essays considering that this is a writing class. But overall, not a lot of weaknesses!

strengths: good learning space, assignments were straightforward
weaknesses: too many readings, some readings were quite dense

The prompts were extremely open ended. This allowed me to delve into topics and papers that interested me. Likewise, the course topic and material were enjoyable and very relevant to current societal problems.
the in class discussions were always very engaging and the albums we listened to throughout the semester were amazing and had great cultural and political significance

I really appreciated the guided readings and weekly albums that were assigned throughout the course. It was organized very well and I felt that each topic was addressed well. I also really liked the amount of engagement between the students and talking with each other about the music and other class topics were very enjoyable.  I do wish that we were able to talk more about writing techniques to adopt throughout the semester(more writing workshops as well).

A strength was that the course is very engaging and we got to do a lot of discussing. A weakness is that some readings for each weak could have been more related to what we talked about with the album.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I like how engaging this class still was considering the unconventional structure of Zoom.

success: flexibility and accommodation for students depending on their circumstances, open communication
improvement: time in class for guided readings of more dense material
Overall, I thought that the zoom sessions/breakout rooms were effective given the circumstances.
the discussions and listening to albums succeeded

I really liked the format of the class over zoom. We were still able to enjoy the music and though I still wish there was a physical component, I still felt that the level of engagement was still high. I liked how we were able to turn off our screens while doing in-class readings.
A thing that I feel succeeded was that we alerted given time during class to read or work on essays which helped us alleviate some of the zoom fatigue.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely, it was interesting and new content. The classroom environment was comfortable and safe for open conversation.
Yes, if you are interested in learning more about neo-soul and improving your writing.
Yes, good topic and relevant lens (historical and contemporary)

Yes--especially if you enjoy neo-soul/hip-hop/R&B music. I normally find writing to be tedious, but I enjoyed research and writing about my favorite artists. Jeong Yeon is a flexible, funny, and relatable professor. Its clear that hes passionate and knowledgeable about the subject matter, and I cannot recommend this course more to anyone looking to fulfill their writing requirement.
yes, I loved this course and the professor was amazing and understanding. I would especially recommend this class to students who love music and appreciate the cultural significance of black music
Absolutely. I am glad that this was my first writing course at Yale and I felt that this class had a positive role in my decision to take more English classes in the future.
I would definitely recommend this course because it is very interesting and you get to listen to music in different ways that expands your listening tastes and preferences.

extras.title:
ENGL 114 21
        In the Wake of Neo Soul
